    Title Generate Data for two outcomes.

    gen.fun.dep.Rd

    Title Generate Data for two outcomes.

    gen.fun.dep(xm, xs, corln, Sigma)

    Arguments

    xm

    A mean matrix with element (i,j) giving the mean of outcome i and time j.

    xs

    A s.d. matrix with element (i,j) giving the s.d. of outcome i and time j.

    corln

    Correlation matrix between the outcomes.

    Sigma

    Covariance Matrix for Random Effect

    Value

    Longitudinal Data with multiple outcomes

    Details

    This function is used inside a for-loop to simulate repeated measures per subject

    Examples

    # Example: simulate 1 subject with 7 visits
library(MASS)
M <- -t(cbind(
  c(0, 0.738, 1.313, 3.109, 4.525, 5.864, 7.338),
  c(0, 0.668, 3.975, 5.931, 8.259, 11.989, 13.976)
))

S <- t(cbind(
  c(0, 4.79, 5.43, 6.54, 7.37, 8.15, 9.11),
  c(0, 10.27, 12.85, 14.95, 15.35, 16.87, 18.19)
))

Sigma <- matrix(c(3.477^2, 0, 0, 3.477^2), nrow = 2)
corr <- matrix(c(1, 0.5, 0.5, 1), nrow = 2)

gen.fun.dep(M, S, corr, Sigma)
#>      [,1]     [,2]      [,3]      [,4]       [,5]       [,6]       [,7]
#> [1,]    0 4.050430  2.653254  6.649710   5.906508   3.539927   8.599772
#> [2,]    0 1.766491 14.825540 -8.730003 -21.132800 -35.542716 -45.155009
